choices.text:
why does this command give error Permission denied (publickey):

ssh -i \“~/UserKey.pem" -C -L 25900:localhost:5900 ec2-34-221-131-108.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com
The error message "Permission denied (publickey):" indicates that the SSH client is unable to authenticate with your server using a public key, even though you have specified it in `~/.ssh/authorized_keys`. This could be due to several reasons such as incorrect file permissions or an outdated version of OpenSSL.
```bash
To troubleshoot this issue: 
1. Check the SSH configuration on both your server and client machines for any differences that may affect key authentication. You can use `ssh -T <server_ip>` to test if you are able to connect using a public key from another machine, or check the logs of the ssh service running on your server (e.g., /var/log/auth.log).
2. Verify that both machines have OpenSSL installed and configured correctly with RSA keys enabled for authentication. You can use `openssl version` to verify this information. 
3. Check if you are using a different SSH client or terminal emulator on your local machine, as some clients may not support certain key types (e.g., DSA vs RSA). If so, try updating the software and/or configuring it with an appropriate public key type for authentication.
